snippet: Boeing and Airbus are leaving the Farnborough International Airshow in Britain with around $54 billion in deals — just over half what they drew last year.
abstract: Boeing and Airbus are leaving the Farnborough International Airshow in Britain with around $54 billion in deals--just over half what they drew in 2011; large backlogs for airplanes have translated into waiting times of several years for airlines, reducing the incentive to sign contracts for more.
lead_paragraph: Boeing and Airbus are leaving the Farnborough International Airshow in Britain with around $54 billion in deals — just over half what they drew last year.

headline.main: At Air Show, Orders Fall For Aircraft Companies
headline.print_headline: At Air Show, Orders Fall For Aircraft Companies
